tools.name: Cell Ranger
tools.function:
Single-cell ATAC-seq data processing: peak calling and generation of a peak x cell matrix

This task involves processing single-cell ATAC-seq data, starting with aligning reads, filtering, and generating a peak x cell matrix. The task uses software tools like Cell Ranger for initial steps, followed by ArchR for quality control, peak calling, and matrix creation. The goal is to identify regions of open chromatin in each cell.

tools.name: Seurat
tools.function:
Single-cell RNA-seq and ATAC-seq data processing and quality control with Seurat and ArchR

This task involves processing single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) and single-cell ATAC sequencing (scATAC-seq) data to ensure data quality. This includes filtering cells based on mitochondrial content, ribosomal gene content, and number of unique genes (scRNA-seq) and identifying doublets.  The remaining cells are normalized and clustered to identify various cell populations. Pseudotime trajectory analysis is performed to assess changes in gene expression across a time course.  The goal is to identify potential non-transcriptional regulation.

tools.name: Epiregulon
tools.function:
Construction of Gene Regulatory Networks (GRNs) using Epiregulon: inferring TF activity from paired scATAC-seq and scRNA-seq data

This is the core task of the paper, where GRNs are constructed. This involves using the paired RNA-seq and ATAC-seq data to infer the activity of transcriptional factors (TFs). The method utilizes the co-occurrence of TF mRNA expression and chromatin accessibility at TF binding sites to predict TF activity.

tools.name: MACS2
tools.function:
ATAC-seq Peak Calling and Peak Annotation with ArchR

This involves processing scATAC-seq data using ArchR. The pipeline includes doublet analysis, latent semantic indexing, clustering, and gene scoring, integration of the scATAC-seq data with the associated scRNA-seq data and peak calling. Peak accessibility correlated with gene expression are assessed.

tools.name: Monocle 3
tools.function:
Pseudotime Trajectory Analysis with Monocle 3

Constructing pseudotime trajectories from matched scRNA-seq and scATAC-seq data to analyze gene expression and chromatin accessibility changes over time. This includes defining the pseudotime, and smoothing scATAC-seq accessibility scores.

tools.name: chromVAR cisBP database
tools.function:
Transcription Factor Motif Analysis and Scoring with GenomicRanges package

The task involves scoring transcription factors in relation to open chromatin regions using the ArchR-provided summit scores with the GenomicRanges package. The overall goal is to rank the transcription factors in a given peak.
